summary:
I am a seasoned Chemical Production Professional with +20 years of international management and consulting experience working with oil & gas, and chemicals industries worldwide. With proven leadership, mentoring, and networking skills, I build highly productive relations with employees, business partners and stakeholders. 

I am also customer and quality oriented with a strategic vision and leadership that drive operational processes, productivity, efficiency and bottom-line improvements. I am skilled in negotiation as well as in advising on capital projects, maintenance outages and major turnarounds.

My core competences are:

📌  Cross-functional Team Leadership
📌  Strategic Planning
📌  Operational Management and Planning
📌  Process Improvement and Change Management
📌  Strategic Consulting
📌  Training / Organisational Development / Capacity Building / Knowledge Management
📌  Technical/Investigative Reporting / Policy Analysis 
📌  Risk Management
📌  Chemical Process Operations
📌  Production / Maintenance Planning
📌  Emergency Management
📌  Project Management

My biggest professional achievements so far: 
• As one of three field team leaders, led multi-disciplinary teams on several highly sensitive missions in Syria within the framework of the UN Security Council resolution, which led to the awarding of the Nobel Peace Prize to the OPCW in 2013
• Held the Chairperson position of the OPCW Staff Representative Association in 2010
• Led about 100 demilitarization and non-proliferation inspections in 40+ countries at the OPCW
• Developed, coordinated, and delivered approximately 30 training programmes in the Netherlands, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Suriname, Germany, the United Kingdom, Italy, Serbia, the Czech Republic, and Slovakia from 2010 to 2020
• At the Sasol One Site (South Africa), managed a chemical production division:
- Controlled annual gas and utilities budgets - 65 million gigajoules, an equivalent to about EUR 35-40M, and quantified financial losses
- Developed initial change and knowledge management processes necessary for the restructuring of two divisions

As a well-travelled professional with a robust work ethic, an adaptable personality, and the ability to thrive in both individual and dynamic team environments, I've developed excellent interpersonal skills grounded in leading cross functional teams and working in culturally and geographically diverse environments, as well as an impressive skillset as a critical thinker, negotiator, mediator, interviewer, and lead decision maker.  

Looking forward to connecting with you!

profile_positions.description:
•	Directed arms control (weapons of mass destruction) inspection teams to over 40 countries to verify the implementation and performance of demilitarisation and non-proliferation operations management mechanisms
•	Led chemical production and demilitarisation facility inspections by assessing technical features, production activities and records management systems
•	Steered negotiations and policy discussions with senior government officials, military representatives, and technical experts from several countries within a confidentiality regime
•	Instructed on key concepts for investigative report writing, process operation and control, process safety, work permit systems, and production planning that allowed cross training of inspector specialities
•	Implemented cohesive knowledge-management processes in specialist fields
•	Acquired practical knowledge of production processes and plant operations in a variety of chemical industries - petrochemical, pharmaceutical, synthetics, formulations, and additives
 
Key Achievements:
•	Led fact-finding and technical assistance inspection activities to enhance the national application of verification policies and organisational decisions in different States Parties:
o	Clarified two longstanding verification irregularities in Denmark and Switzerland by reaching consensus with senior national representatives, on-site inspections, and interviews with site personnel – these results were presented to the Executive Council of the OPCW and accepted by Member States
o	Led two further inspections to German chemical production sites to close technical and legal uncertainties in declaration and verification requirements in accordance with the Chemical Weapons Convention
•	Revamped Chemical Production Technologist (CPT) training to enhance synergies with other speciality inspector training to make CPT’s deployable on a wider range of mission types
